moves.1. e4 d5 2. exd5 Qxd5 3. Nc3 Qa5 4. Nf3: Move bishop to where it can threaten knight and then rook.
moves.25... Nxg3 26. fxg3 Qf6 27. Rf1: Place rook on f line to discourage queen from getting too close to my king. Rook can also threaten the f-pawn near Black's king.
moves.27... Qe6 28. Bh5: Threaten the rook. I expect it to move to f6 to force a rook exchange, but instead ...
moves.28... Rxg3: Black sacrifices the rook to disrupt my kingside pawn structure. Black used a knight and then a rook to take out 2 kingside pawns.
moves.29. hxg3 Bg4: I think Black would have been better off with BxN.
moves.30. Bxf7+: Bishop forks the queen and king!
moves.30... Qxf7 31. Rxf7: Once Black takes the rook, I would still have an 8 point advantage, so Black resigned.
